0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Skin hypopigmented, Due to vitiligo, scars, and other causes: use applicator to apply evenly to areas of skin to be darkened, allow to remain on skin for at least 2 h; if darker color is desired, apply once every 4 h until desired shade develops

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Skin hypopigmented, Due to vitiligo, scars, and other causes

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• discontinue if rash develops
  • do not apply to abraded or denuded skin or if a rash is present
  • do not apply to eyelids or around eyes
  • may stain hair or clothing when freshly applied

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

0.title: US Trade Names
0.mono:
• Bain DE Soleil Streakguard
  • Bain DE Soleil Sunless
  • Bain DE Soleil Sunless Tanning
  • Chromelin
  • Deeptan Sunless
  • Neutrogena Glow Sunless Tanning

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • avoid contact with eyes
  • avoid contact with clothing until dry
  • do not rub into skin; wait three hours before washing
  • for darker shades, allow coat to dry before reapplication

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Warn patient that drug may stain hair or clothing when freshly applied. Patient should avoid drug contact with clothing until application dries.
  • Advise patient that product is not a sunscreen and does not protect against sunburn.
  • Instruct patient to discontinue use if rash develops and report to healthcare professional.
  • Patient should avoid drug contact with eyes, rash, or abraded/denuded skin.
